section.paragraph0: The Power of Women Working Together

The Canadian Federation of University Women/Saskatoon Inc. has been offering scholarships to female students at the University of Saskatchewan since 1940. Over $300,000 has been awarded since the program's inception. Funding in support of these scholarships comes from members, families and friends of members, and bequests. Our largest annual infusion of money comes from our gigantic fall book sale.
section.paragraph1: We offer up to eleven Undergraduate and six Graduate Scholarships.

section.paragraph0: Undergraduate scholarships of $2,500 each are offered annually to female students in any field of study who have maintained an average of 75% or higher. The awards are given only to full-time students at the University of Saskatchewan. Preference is given to students working on their first degree. The application deadline date for Undergraduate Scholarships is May 31. Applicants are informed of awards in July or early August. The scholarships and criteria are as follows:

section.paragraph2: Seven scholarships are available: two for students who have completed 1 year of university studies, five for which at least 2 years of studies are completed, and one award that stipulates preference to a mature applicant who is continuing studies after an interruption in education of several years. These renamed scholarships are established in the names and memory of Annie B. and Isabel Shaw, Mary Hallett, Jean Bayer, Harriet Kaplan, sisters Winnie and Edith Rowles, Grace Swanson, and Vivian Morton.
awarded to a mature woman who has completed at least 1 year of university studies, with preference given to a parent.
available to a student who has completed at least 1 year of university studies and needs financial support and is not likely to receive numerous or major awards.
available to a student who has completed 3 or more years of university studies and demonstrates financial need. Given similar qualifications, preference will be given to a single parent.

section.paragraph2: open to male and female students, by request of the donor, enrolled in Fine Arts studies (Drama, Music, Art, or Art History).

section.paragraph0: Graduate scholarships of $2,500 are offered annually as well as one doctoral scholarship of $5,000. These awards are directed towards women completing their degrees. They will be awarded to female graduate students who are not recipients of any other substantial scholarship(s). The students must have completed at least one year of course work and have an approved thesis or project proposal.
section.paragraph1: There are additional requirements specific to each of the six graduate scholarships below:

section.paragraph3: These awards are intended to be used to cover expenses associated with the thesis completion. This may include the purchase of materials and preparation of the text.
This award may be used for any expenses incurred in completing the degree. At the request of the donor, given otherwise similar qualifications, preference may be given to a single mother.

The Newstead Doctoral Scholarship is awarded to a female Ph.D. student who has completed all the required courses, including the comprehensive exams for the degree, and is well-advanced in the writing of the thesis. Given similar qualifications, preference is given to a student who demonstrates financial need, or whose research is of potential benefit to women in society.

section.paragraph1: The student applies by sending the application form (use the link below) to the College of Graduate Studies and Research along with:

section.paragraph0: A one-page letter of intent. The letter should include the title of the thesis or project, description of the research (in terms that are easily understood by a non-technical reader), research methodology, objectives, motivation for embarking on research, and professional goals upon completion of the work;
section.paragraph1: A list of current University Scholarships and distinctions won, including amount, tenure, and source;
section.paragraph2: The source and amount of monetary support, including research grants, stipends, teaching assistantships, lab technician wages, and also other sources of income;
section.paragraph3: A list of publications, conferences and poster presentations, and related work and/or volunteer experiences;
section.paragraph4: A letter of recommendation from the research supervisor outlining the student's personal qualities and past achievements and potential. It should state the student's current progress in the program, the estimated completion date, and the financial support that is being provided to the student. This letter should be sent directly from the department to the College of Graduate Studies and Research.

section.paragraph0: In accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations, Social Insurance Numbers will be required from all scholarship winners and their applications will be retained by CFUW Saskatoon Inc. for six years.

section.paragraph1: This award was established in 2017-18 to mark the 100th Anniversary of CFUW Saskatoon Inc. Two $1,000 bursaries were awarded in September, 2018. The Saskatchewan Polytechnic bursaries are intended to encourage and recognize Saskatchewan female students enrolled in programs under-represented by women.
section.paragraph2: Two bursaries per year are awarded. In 2020, the value of the bursaries increased to $1,500. These bursaries are separate from the U of S scholarships. Applications and selection of recipients are handled by the Saskatchewan Polytechnic Donor and Alumni Relations Office.
section.paragraph3: Applications are open in the spring for awards in the fall. Applicants must be enrolled full-time on Campus, either in Year One of a diploma program that has less than 30% female enrolment or having completed one year of a program and are enrolled in Year Two of the program.

section.paragraph1: This annual award was established in 2004. In appreciation for the use of an available book-sorting storage space in the Saskatoon Public School Division, CFUW Saskatoon Inc. established a bursary valued at $750. The bursary was intended to support students who had not completed their high-school education for various reasons and were upgrading in order to pursue their academic goals, rising above adversity to achieve their education. In 2020, the value increased to $1,000.
section.paragraph2: The bursary is eligible for Royal West Campus students who are graduating, having taken a minimum of three classes with the Royal West Campus program or having taken a minimum of three upgrading courses in the current year. The application deadline is May 31. Applicants must have applied and been accepted in a post-secondary program for the current year. Royal West Campus forwards the applications to CFUW Saskatoon for the selection process. The successful applicant is presented the award at the Royal West Campus June Graduation Farewell.
